title: Coding the Covid-19 Pandemic in Germany
text: ambulatory sector, National Association Statutory Health Insurance Physicians (Kassenärztliche Bundesvereinigung, KBV) released guideline Corona-related diagnoses: KBV Coding Guidlines KBV Coding Overview flyer illustrating various coding scenarios also issued Zi, health services research institute KBV. ambulatory system, codes must accompanied additional flag diagnostic status (German: Zusatzzeichen für die Diagnosesicherheit). KBV guidance states , general, flag “G” (German gesichert, English secured) used. however cases flag can used, see .

title: Coding the Covid-19 Pandemic in Germany
text: Introduced 13 February 2020, U07.1 codes Covid-19 cases confirmed laboratory testing. Although primary code version ICD-10, included secondary code ICD-10-GM. means always accompanied primary code denoting manifestation (e.g. J06.9 J12.8 symptomatic patients; Z20.8 testing contacts confirmed cases). flag “” (German Ausschluss, English excluded) can used denote test result negative occurs frequently practice. flag “Z” (German Zustand nach, English condition post diagnosis) may used denote prior infection relevance subsequent treatment episode. code carried unchanged 2021 version ICD-10-GM. 17 February 2020: ICD-10 (und GM): U07.1 kodiert COVID-19, Coronavirus-Krankheit-2019

title: Coding the Covid-19 Pandemic in Germany
text: code introduced 23 Match 2020 denote “clinical epidemiological” diagnosis. used Covid-19 assumed confirmed testing. example, U07.2 recommended corona test negative test available, patient symptoms contact confirmed case, associated cluster viral pneumonia care home. code carried unchanged 2021 version ICD-10-GM. 23 March 2020: ICD-10 (und GM): U07.2 kodiert Verdacht auf COVID-19

title: Coding the Covid-19 Pandemic in Germany
text: code U99.0 denotes test SARS-CoV-2 virus conducted. indicate result test. secondary key usually coded alongside Z20.8 (“Contact exposure communicable diseases”). asymptomatic testing, appropriate code Z11 (“Special screening examination infectious parasitic diseases”). code carried unchanged 2021 version ICD-10-GM. 25 May 2020: ICD-10-GM 2020: Neuer U-Kode U99.0! und neue Kodierfrage zu Testung auf SARS-CoV-2 information: Ist U07.2! bei Personen zu kodieren, bei denen kein Verdacht auf eine Infektion mit SARS-CoV-2 besteht, jedoch ein Test auf SARS-CoV-2 durchgeführt wurde, welcher negativ ausfällt? (ICD-10-GM Nr. 1019) Wie sind im Zusammenhang mit COVID-19 die Zusatzschlüsselnummern U07.1! und U07.2! sowie U99.0! zu verwenden? (ICD-10-GM Nr. 1018)

title: Coding the Covid-19 Pandemic in Germany
text: 11 November 2020 (middle second wave Germany), three codes published: U07.3: Personal history COVID-19 U07.4!: Post COVID-19 condition U07.5: Multisystem inflammatory syndrome associated COVID-19 ICD-10-GM 2020: Weitere neue U-Kodes im Zusammenhang mit COVID-19 publiziert codes differed introduced . result, codes reallocated ICD-10-GM 2021 follows: U08.9: Personal history COVID-19 U09.9!: Post COVID-19 condition U10.9: Multisystem inflammatory syndrome associated COVID-19 ICD-10-GM 2021: Dateiaustausch wegen neuer Kodes U08-U10 im Zusammenhang mit COVID-19 codes may found alongside primary code Z09.88 (“Follow-examination”).

title: Coding the Covid-19 Pandemic in Germany
text: 11 March 2021, two codes relating Coronavirus vaccination programme added: U11.9: Need immunization COVID-19 U12.9!: COVID-19 vaccines causing adverse effects therapeutic use codes correspond official version ICD-10. ambulatory sector, code U12.9 may used alongside flags “G” (German gesichert, English secured), “V” (German Verdacht auf, English suspected), “” (German Ausschluss von, English excluded) “Z” (German Zustand nach, English status following) describe precisely nature (assumed) adverse effects. ICD-10-GM 2021: Neue U-Kodes im Zusammenhang mit Impfungen gegen COVID-19 publiziert

what: Codes Relating to Covid-19 Symptoms and Sequalae
title: Coding the Covid-19 Pandemic in Germany
text: addition newly-introduced codes, physicians may choose use existing codes document symptoms Covid-19. Examples include: R05: Cough R06: Abnormalities breathing R43: Disturbances smell taste R50: Fever post covid syndrome (U09.9!) secondary code, accompanied primary code specifying nature complaint. practice, may symptom, disease resulting infection, code relating functional psychiatric condition, example: F48.0: Neurasthenia G93.3: Chronic fatigue syndrome F41: Anxiety

title: Introduction to the ICD10gm Package
text: ICD10gm R Package working German Modification International Statistical Classification Diseases Related Health Problems (ICD-10-GM). ICD-10 classification international standard coding health service data. used widely document morbidity healthcare systems, usually context remuneration claims, encode mortality statistics. Germany, German Instutite Medical Documentation Information (DIMDI) releases German Modification (ICD-10-GM) classification forms compulsory part remuneration claims ambulatory hospital sectors. information historical context can found , example, Graubner (2007) Jetté et al (2010).

title: Introduction to the ICD10gm Package
text: package created facilitate analysis data coded using ICD-10-GM. particular, following aims: Provide convenient access extended ICD-10-GM metadata Identify extract ICD-10 codes character strings Facilitate specification ICD codes analysis, utilising ICD hierarchy (e.g. given specification “A0” return subcodes range “A01” “A09”) Enable historization ICD specifications analysing longitudinal claims data, applying automatic code transitions provided DIMDI, identifying potentially problematic codes enabling specification custom transitions ICD10gm designed use context medical health services research using routinely collected claims data. suitable use operative coding include relevant metadata (e.g. inclusion exclusion notes detailed definitions psychiatric diagnoses). metadata provided ICD10gm package intended replace official DIMDI documentation, always consulted specifying ICD codes analysis. following presents overview basic functionality provided ICD10gm package, illustrated means simple examples. access vignette R, type:
code: vignette("icd10gm_intro", package = "ICD10gm")

title: Introduction to the ICD10gm Package
text: ICD-10-GM metadata provided four data.frames form core ICD10gm package: icd_meta_chapters: Specification ICD-10-GM chapters label number (Arabic Roman numerals) icd_meta_blocks: Specification ICD-10 blocks, containing sequence related ICD-10 codes icd_meta_codes: Extended metadata ICD-10-GM codes icd_meta_transitions: “crosswalk” table specifying old new ICD-10-GM codes successive annual versions. Documentation individual datasets can accessed using R help system typing, example, either help("icd_meta_codes", package = "ICD10gm") simply ?icd_meta_codes. column names translated English, ICD-10-GM labels German UTF-8 character encoding throughout. addition tabular data, several utility functions provided perform common queries metadata. Interactive code lookup: icd_lookup (lookup ICD-10 code console), icd_browse (lookup ICD-10-GM official Online documentation) icd_search (search ICD-10-GM labels). Manual code history validation: icd_showchanges icd_showchanges_icd3 query icd_meta_transitions return entries affected changes ICD-10-GM versions.

title: Introduction to the ICD10gm Package
text: First, load ICD10gm package alongside tidyverse packages: way example, examine coding unspecific gastroenteritis (.e. without identification specific cause), common diagnosis primary care. can look appropriate code follows: see A09 used infectious gastroenteritis, whereas K52 corresponds non-infectious gastroenteritis. interested A09, might wish read details official documentation: open documentation system’s default browser. Now, check whether whether code affected code transitions revision since 2003: Diagnoses , prior 2009, coded K52.9 now coded A09.9. can investigate exactly changed looking relevant codes years 2009 2010: Prior 2010, A09 reserved gastroenteritis presumed infectious origin (German: vermutlich infektiösen Ursprungs), unspecified gastroenteritis coded K52.9. Since 2010, A09.9 codes unspecified gastroenteritis, K52.9 reserved cases determined non-infectious. effect change A09.9 replaced K52.9 unspecific code used document vast majority routine cases primary care. Failure account constitute major error medical epidemiological research.
code: library(dplyr) library(purrr) library(tidyr) library(ICD10gm) icd_search("gastroenteritis", level = 3) #>        year icd3 icd_sub #> 299205 2023  A09     A09 #> 304723 2023  K52     K52 #>                                                                                                                      label #> 299205 Sonstige und nicht näher bezeichnete Gastroenteritis und Kolitis infektiösen und nicht näher bezeichneten Ursprungs #> 304723                                                                Sonstige nichtinfektiöse Gastroenteritis und Kolitis icd_browse("A09") icd_showchanges_icd3("A09") %>%   knitr::kable(row.names = FALSE) get_icd_labels(icd3 = c("A09", "K52"), year = 2009:2010) %>%   arrange(year, icd_sub) %>%    filter(icd_sub %in% c("K529") | icd3 == "A09") %>%    select(year, icd_normcode, label) %>%    knitr::kable(row.names = FALSE)

what: Test whether a string represents an ICD-10-GM code
title: Introduction to the ICD10gm Package
text: function is_icd_code tests whether character vector represents valid ICD-10-GM code (.e. code listed data.frame icd_meta_codes, allowing alternative code specifications). test may limited particular version ICD-10-GM specifying year argument.

previous_headings: Basic Use > Test whether a string represents an ICD-10-GM code
title: Introduction to the ICD10gm Package
text: function is_icd_code recognises ICD codes regardless formatting, returning TRUE string recognised ICD code FALSE otherwise:
code: is_icd_code(c("E10.1", "E101", "E10.1-", "J44", "This is not an ICD code")) #> [1]  TRUE  TRUE  TRUE  TRUE FALSE

what: Extracting ICD codes from a string
title: Introduction to the ICD10gm Package
text: function icd_parse extracts ICD-10 codes arbitrary character vector. one hand, may used icd_expand function convert ICD-10 codes standardised format extract parts code. hand, may used extract potentially many ICD-10 codes document can converted text format (perhaps using pdftools package scrape PDF document rvest scrape website).

previous_headings: Basic Use > Extracting ICD codes from a string
what: Example: Scraping codes from a website
title: Introduction to the ICD10gm Package
text: example ICD10gm can used extract ICD codes arbitrary text, following code uses rvest package scrape code block “A00-A09” online version DIMDI ICD-10-GM reference. apply filter exclude codes A10, thus revealing ICD-10 codes reference block. simply package building process, code evaluated. left exercise reader.
code: library(dplyr) library(rvest)  read_html("https://www.dimdi.de/static/de/klassifikationen/icd/icd-10-gm/kode-suche/htmlgm2018/block-a00-a09.htm") %>%    html_text() %>%   icd_parse(type = "bounded") %>%   select(-icd_spec) %>%    unique() %>%    filter(icd_sub >= "A10") %>%    arrange(icd_sub) %>%    left_join(     get_icd_labels(year = 2018)[, c("icd_sub", "icd_normcode", "label")],     by = "icd_sub") %>%    select(icd_normcode, label) %>%    knitr::kable(row.names = FALSE,                caption = "Additional ICD-10 codes referred to in block A00-A09 (Intestional infectious diseases) of the ICD-10-GM (2018).")

what: Expand a ICD specification down the hierarchy
title: Introduction to the ICD10gm Package
text: function icd_expand takes data.frame containing ICD codes optional metadata input. returns data.frame containing ICD codes specified level hierarchy (e.g. specification “E11” expanded include three, four five-digit codes beginning E11). Expansion done within specified version ICD-10-GM (e.g. year 2018).

previous_headings: Basic Use > Expand a ICD specification down the hierarchy
title: Introduction to the ICD10gm Package
text: Irritable bowel syndrome coded using either three-digit code K58 (conceiving IBS somatic condition) code F45.32 (focussing IBS psychosomatic condition). can retrieve subcodes year 2019 follows: Note data.frame containing specification normally stored separate metadata file (eg. csv Excel format) facilitate maintenance sharing specification. column DIAG_GROUP label can allocated one multiple rows specification useful aggregating diagnoses. similar concept diagnosis groupers used, example, risk adjustment schemes (e.g. operated German Federal Social Insurance Office). case, may want treat two alternative codes equivalent allocating label “IBS” . way, overcome common problem , practice, multiple codes used document underlying disease.
code: icd_k58 <- data.frame(DIAG_GROUP = c("IBS", "IBS"), ICD_SPEC = c("K58", "F45.32")) %>%    icd_expand(col_icd = "ICD_SPEC", year = 2019, col_meta = "DIAG_GROUP")    knitr::kable(icd_k58)

title: Introduction to the ICD10gm Package
text: function icd_history takes result icd_expand, specified particular year, returns data.frame containing corresponding codes specified years (2003). , applies ICD-10-GM transition tables map codes successive ICD-10-GM versions. automatic transitions followed ensure specification retains meaning. Custom transitions, tailored needs project hand, can specified yield complete history.

title: Introduction to the ICD10gm Package
text: historise code K58, specified year 2019, backwards obtain corresponding codes years 2017 2019:
code: icd_history(icd_k58, years = 2017:2019) %>%    select(icd_spec, DIAG_GROUP, year, icd_code) %>%    arrange(year, icd_code) #> # A tibble: 12 × 4 #>    icd_spec DIAG_GROUP  year icd_code #>    <chr>    <chr>      <int> <chr>    #>  1 F4532    IBS         2017 F45.32   #>  2 K58      IBS         2017 K58.0    #>  3 K58      IBS         2017 K58.9    #>  4 F4532    IBS         2018 F45.32   #>  5 K58      IBS         2018 K58.0    #>  6 K58      IBS         2018 K58.9    #>  7 F4532    IBS         2019 F45.32   #>  8 K58      IBS         2019 K58.-    #>  9 K58      IBS         2019 K58.1    #> 10 K58      IBS         2019 K58.2    #> 11 K58      IBS         2019 K58.3    #> 12 K58      IBS         2019 K58.8

title: Introduction to the ICD10gm Package
text: Program code released MIT license. underlying ICD-10-GM metadata copyright German Instutite Medical Documentation Information (DIMDI). source files available free charge DIMDI Download Centre. believe use package compatible copyright restrictions. particular: distribution “added-value product” derived original DIMDI classification files expressly permitted. Distribution original classification files forbidden. Consequently, package distributes code required process files. wishing compile data scratch must download files DIMDI download centre agree copyright restrictions. package modify ICD-10-GM codes, texts metadata way restructure data convenient form. package contain commercial advertising. source data clearly stated, main package documentation.

title: Introduction to the ICD10gm Package
text: ICD10gm package provides convenient means accessing manipulating German modification ICD-10 classification. designed use medical, epidemiological health services research. author’s knowledge, package represents publicly available repository pre-processed metadata ICD-10-GM. Indeed, key contribution package compilation processing metadata provided DIMDI, designed needs operational use purpose longitudinal secondary data analysis. Building metadata, ICD10gm package provides various functions facilitate analysis ICD-10 data. Possible uses include: Calculating administrative prevalence diseases time, accounting changes ICD-10-GM classification. extraction ICD-10 codes purposes text mining. implementation diagnoses grouping systems representation patient morbidity.

title: Introduction to the ICD10gm Package
text: icd package similar aims slightly different approach focusses US version ICD-10 system.

title: Metadata Processing for the German Modification of the ICD-10 Coding System
text: ICD-10 classification diseases related health problems (ICD-10) international standard coding health service data. Germany, Federal Institute Drugs Medical Devices releases German Modification (ICD-10-GM) classification forms compulsory part remuneration claims ambulatory hospital sectors. package created facilitate analysis data coded using ICD-10-GM. particular, following aims: Provide convenient access extended ICD-10-GM metadata Identify extract ICD-10 codes character strings Facilitate specification ICD codes analysis, utilising ICD hierarchy (e.g. given specification “A0” return subcodes range “A01” “A09”) Enable historization ICD specifications applying automatic code transitions provided DIMDI, identifying potentially problematic codes ICD10gm designed use context medical health services research using routinely collected claims data. suitable use operative coding include relevant metadata (e.g. inclusion exclusion notes detailed definitions psychiatric diagnoses). metadata provided ICD10gm package intended replace official documentation, always consulted specifying ICD codes analysis.

what: Lookup a 3-digit ICD-10-GM code in the official BfArM browser — icd_browse
title: Lookup a 3-digit ICD-10-GM code in the official BfArM browser — icd_browse
text: Given 3-digit ICD-10-GM code, function generate URL corresponding page BfArM ICD-10-GM browser, use browseURL() open .

title: Lookup a 3-digit ICD-10-GM code in the official BfArM browser — icd_browse
code: icd_browse(icd3, year = NULL, open_browser = TRUE)

title: Lookup a 3-digit ICD-10-GM code in the official BfArM browser — icd_browse
text: icd3 3-digit ICD-10-GM code (e.g. "A01") year ICD-10-GM version (default: recent available version). works year >= 2009. open_browser Whether open ICD-10-GM documentation default browser (Default: TRUE, primary intention function)

title: Lookup a 3-digit ICD-10-GM code in the official BfArM browser — icd_browse
text: Called side-effect, returns URL invisibly icd_search() search string ICD-10-GM labels icd_lookup() lookup ICD-10-GM code console

title: Lookup a 3-digit ICD-10-GM code in the official BfArM browser — icd_browse
text: currently provides correct URL ICD-10-GM versions 2009. Given BfArM still using old dimdi.de domain purpose, possible URL schema change near future. convenience function intended interactive use.

title: Lookup a 3-digit ICD-10-GM code in the official BfArM browser — icd_browse
code: icd_browse("R50", open_browser = FALSE)

what: Expand list of ICD codes to include all possible subcodes — icd_expand
title: Expand list of ICD codes to include all possible subcodes — icd_expand
text: function icd_expand takes data.frame containing ICD codes optional metadata input. returns data.frame containing ICD codes specified level hierarchy (e.g. specification "E11" expanded include three, four five-digit codes beginning E11).

title: Expand list of ICD codes to include all possible subcodes — icd_expand
code: icd_expand(   icd_in,   year,   col_icd = "ICD",   col_meta = NULL,   type = "strict",   ignore_icd_errors = FALSE )

title: Expand list of ICD codes to include all possible subcodes — icd_expand
text: icd_in Data frame defining ICD codes interest year ICD 10 version col_icd Column icd_in containing ICD codes (Default: ICD) col_meta (Optional) Columns containing meta information retain (e.g. Grouper, age criteria later use). left NULL, col_icd retained. type character string determining strictly matching performed, passed icd_parse. must one "strict" (str contains ICD code extraneous characters), bounded (str contains ICD code word boundary sides) weak (ICD codes extracted even contained within word, e.g. "E10Diabetes" return "E10"). Default: strict. ignore_icd_errors logical. Whether ignore incorrectly specified input (potentially leading incomplete output) stop ICD specification correspond valid ICD code. Default: FALSE, stop error.

title: Expand list of ICD codes to include all possible subcodes — icd_expand
text: data.frame columns YEAR, ICD_CODE, ICD_COMPRESSED, ICD_LABEL , specified, columns specified col_meta

title: Expand list of ICD codes to include all possible subcodes — icd_expand
code: # Incomplete or non-terminal codes expand to the right. # This is useful to specified code blocks in a compact manner icd_meta <- data.frame(ICD = "R1") icd_expand(icd_meta, year = 2019) #> # A tibble: 33 × 7 #>    icd_spec  year icd3  icd_code icd_normcode icd_sub label                      #>    <chr>    <int> <chr> <chr>    <chr>        <chr>   <chr>                      #>  1 R1        2019 R10   R10.-    R10          R10     Bauch- und Beckenschmerzen #>  2 R1        2019 R10   R10.0    R10.0        R100    Akutes Abdomen             #>  3 R1        2019 R10   R10.1    R10.1        R101    Schmerzen im Bereich des … #>  4 R1        2019 R10   R10.2    R10.2        R102    Schmerzen im Becken und a… #>  5 R1        2019 R10   R10.3    R10.3        R103    Schmerzen mit Lokalisatio… #>  6 R1        2019 R10   R10.4    R10.4        R104    Sonstige und nicht näher … #>  7 R1        2019 R11   R11      R11          R11     Übelkeit und Erbrechen     #>  8 R1        2019 R12   R12      R12          R12     Sodbrennen                 #>  9 R1        2019 R13   R13.-    R13          R13     Dysphagie                  #> 10 R1        2019 R13   R13.0    R13.0        R130    Dysphagie mit Beaufsichti… #> # … with 23 more rows  # Optional metadata columns can be carried # through with the specification icd_meta <- data.frame(ICD = "M54", icd_label = "Back pain") icd_expand(icd_meta, year = 2019, col_meta = "icd_label") #> # A tibble: 50 × 8 #>    icd_spec icd_label  year icd3  icd_code icd_normcode icd_sub label            #>    <chr>    <chr>     <int> <chr> <chr>    <chr>        <chr>   <chr>            #>  1 M54      Back pain  2019 M54   M54.-    M54          M54     Rückenschmerzen  #>  2 M54      Back pain  2019 M54   M54.0-   M54.0        M540    Pannikulitis in… #>  3 M54      Back pain  2019 M54   M54.00   M54.00       M5400   Pannikulitis in… #>  4 M54      Back pain  2019 M54   M54.01   M54.01       M5401   Pannikulitis in… #>  5 M54      Back pain  2019 M54   M54.02   M54.02       M5402   Pannikulitis in… #>  6 M54      Back pain  2019 M54   M54.03   M54.03       M5403   Pannikulitis in… #>  7 M54      Back pain  2019 M54   M54.04   M54.04       M5404   Pannikulitis in… #>  8 M54      Back pain  2019 M54   M54.05   M54.05       M5405   Pannikulitis in… #>  9 M54      Back pain  2019 M54   M54.06   M54.06       M5406   Pannikulitis in… #> 10 M54      Back pain  2019 M54   M54.07   M54.07       M5407   Pannikulitis in… #> # … with 40 more rows

what: Historize a list of ICD codes to cover the specified years — icd_history
title: Historize a list of ICD codes to cover the specified years — icd_history
text: function icd_history takes result icd_expand, specified particular year, returns data.frame containing corresponding codes specified years (2003). , applies ICD-10-GM transition tables map codes successive ICD-10-GM versions. automatic transitions followed.

title: Historize a list of ICD codes to cover the specified years — icd_history
code: icd_history(icd_expand, years, custom_transitions = NULL)

title: Historize a list of ICD codes to cover the specified years — icd_history
text: icd_expand data.frame (e.g. generated function icd_expand) years Years historize (e.g. 2005:2014) custom_transitions (Optional) data.frame containing custom transitions complement official transitions provided icd_meta_transition.

title: Historize a list of ICD codes to cover the specified years — icd_history
text: data.frame columns YEAR, ICD_CODE, ICD_COMPRESSED, ICD_LABEL , specified, DIAG_GROUP #' @seealso icd_expand() generate necessary input

title: Historize a list of ICD codes to cover the specified years — icd_history
code: # Between 2018 and 2019, causalgia (G56.4) was reclassified # under G90 as a complex regional pain syndrome icd_meta <- data.frame(ICD = "G56.4", ICD_LABEL = "Causalgia") icd_meta_expanded <- icd_expand(icd_meta, year = 2018, col_meta = "ICD_LABEL") icd_history(icd_meta_expanded, years = 2018:2019) #> # A tibble: 2 × 8 #>   icd_spec ICD_LABEL  year icd3  icd_code icd_normcode icd_sub label             #>   <chr>    <chr>     <int> <chr> <chr>    <chr>        <chr>   <chr>             #> 1 G564     Causalgia  2018 G56   G56.4    G56.4        G564    Kausalgie         #> 2 G564     Causalgia  2019 G90   G90.60   G90.60       G9060   Komplexes region…

what: Lookup an ICD-10 code in R — icd_lookup
title: Lookup an ICD-10 code in R — icd_lookup
text: convenience function quickly look label associated one ICD-10 codes. default, performs lookup using recent version ICD-10-GM available.

title: Lookup an ICD-10 code in R — icd_lookup
code: icd_lookup(icd, year = NULL, expand = TRUE)

title: Lookup an ICD-10 code in R — icd_lookup
text: icd ICD code look (format can recognised icd_parse) year ICD-10-GM version use (Default: recent year available) expand subcodes given code returned? (Default: TRUE)

title: Lookup an ICD-10 code in R — icd_lookup
text: tibble three columns: (year, icd_sub, label) one row result

title: Lookup an ICD-10 code in R — icd_lookup
text: convenience function intended interactive use. browser opened R used interactively. function always returns invisibly URL page opened.

title: Lookup an ICD-10 code in R — icd_lookup
code: icd_lookup("E10.9") #>   year icd_sub #> 1 2023    E109 #> 2 2023   E1090 #> 3 2023   E1091 #>                                                                           label #> 1                                 Diabetes mellitus, Typ 1: Ohne Komplikationen #> 2 Diabetes mellitus, Typ 1: Ohne Komplikationen: Nicht als entgleist bezeichnet #> 3       Diabetes mellitus, Typ 1: Ohne Komplikationen: Als entgleist bezeichnet

what: data.frame containing metadata for the ICD-10-GM code blocks — icd_meta_blocks
title: data.frame containing metadata for the ICD-10-GM code blocks — icd_meta_blocks
text: ICD blocks (German: "Gruppen") constitute level hierarchy chapters three-digit codes. three-digit code grouped sequence form 240 groups represent similar aetiological diagnoses. Unlike grouper systems, ICD blocks consider similar diagnoses different chapters ICD classification, example chronic pain coded unspecific symptom (R52.1) somatoform disorder (F45.4).

title: data.frame containing metadata for the ICD-10-GM code blocks — icd_meta_blocks
code: icd_meta_blocks

title: data.frame containing metadata for the ICD-10-GM code blocks — icd_meta_blocks
text: object class data.frame 4813 rows 6 columns.

title: data.frame containing metadata for the ICD-10-GM code blocks — icd_meta_blocks
text: source data downloaded official download centre German Institute Medical Documentation Information (DIMDI). See also https://www.dimdi.de/dynamic/en/classifications/icd/icd-10-gm/tabular-list/structure/

title: data.frame containing metadata for the ICD-10-GM code blocks — icd_meta_blocks
text: year Year validity (2004) icd_block_first First three-digit ICD code block icd_block_last Last three-digit ICD code block chapter ICD-10 chapter block belongs block_label Label block block_id Short label block format "A00-A09"

what: data.frame containing metadata for all ICD-10-GM codes — icd_meta_codes
title: data.frame containing metadata for all ICD-10-GM codes — icd_meta_codes
text: DIMDI provide CSV file metadata valid codes. table read minor modifications facilitate changes versions.

title: data.frame containing metadata for all ICD-10-GM codes — icd_meta_codes
code: icd_meta_codes

title: data.frame containing metadata for all ICD-10-GM codes — icd_meta_codes
text: data.frame containing following variables: year Year validity (2004) level Level hierarchy (3, 4 5 digits) terminal Whether code terminal code (.e. subcodes) (T: yes; N: ) subcode_type Whether subcode pre- postcombinated (X: precombinated; S: postcombinated). Precombinated codes listed directly three-digit ICD code, whereas postcombinated codes lists possible values fourth fifth digits specific particular code (e.g. group E10-E14 shares common list postcombinated fourth fifth digits) chapter_nr Chapter number (arabic digits 1-22) icd_block_first First code respective ICD block, can used join table ICD10gm::icd_meta_blocks icd_code Full icd code (7 characters) symbols except "dagger" (aetiological codes can combined "asterisk" code denote manifestation) icd_normcode ICD "normcode", consisting 6 characters without symbols except period (e.g. E11.30) icd_sub Complete ICD code without symbols punctuation, consisting 5 characters  (e.g. E1130) label ICD label complete code. label_icd3 ICD label three-digit ICD code. label_icd4 ICD label fourth digit ICD code. label_icd5 ICD label fifth digit ICD code. usage_295 Usage code ambulatory sector (Paragraph 295 SGB V) (P: primary code; O: "star" code conjunction "dagger" code aetiology; Z: optional "!" code conjunction primary code; V: used coding) usage_301 Usage code stationary (hospital) sector (Paragraph 301 SGB V) (P: primary code; O: "star" code conjunction "dagger" code aetiology; Z: optional "!" code conjunction primary code; V: used coding) mort_list1 Key join mortality list 1 mort_list2 Key join mortality list 2 mort_list3 Key join mortality list 3 mort_list4 Key join mortality list 4 morb_list Key join morbidity list gender_specific Whether diagnosis gender specific (M: male; W: female; 9: gender specific) gender_error_type Type error implied field gender_specific (9: irrelevant; K: possible error) age_min Minimum age diagnosis plausible (T001: one day; Y005: five years) age_max Maximum age diagnosis plausible (T010: 10 days; Y005: five years) age_error_type Type error resulting implausible age (9: irrelevant; M: always error ("Muss-Fehler"); K: possible error ("Kann-Fehler")) rare_in_central_europe Indicates whether diagnosis rare Central Europe (J: yes; N: ) code_with_content Indicates whether code content associated (J: yes; N: , leads error) notifiable Indicates whether diagnosis notifiable Germany (J: yes; N: ) notifiable_lab Indicates whether diagnosis notifiable laboratories Germany (J: yes; N: )

title: data.frame containing metadata for all ICD-10-GM codes — icd_meta_codes
text: source data downloaded official download centre German Institute Medical Documentation Information (DIMDI). See also https://www.dimdi.de/dynamic/en/classifications/icd/icd-10-gm/tabular-list/#metadata

title: data.frame containing metadata for all ICD-10-GM codes — icd_meta_codes
text: metadata suitable operative coding include relevant information concerning codes. example, file contains neither inclusion exclusion notes detailed definitions (present, mainly Chapter V). DIMDI provide additional reference material operative coding detailed research. block U00-U49 contains reserved codes can allocated quickly documentation new diseases epidemiological phenomena. usage allowed mandated DIMDI. particular, codes may utilised initiative parties, example, clinical trials contractual purposes. Notable uses reserved codes Zika COVID-19 viruses. included DIMDI online documentation, download files. therefore added manually data set documented package source. Die Schlüsselnummern U05.0-U05.9 dieser Kategorie sollen ein schnelles Reagieren auf aktuelle epidemiologische Phänomene ermöglichen. Sie dürfen nur zusätzlich benutzt werden, um einen anderenorts klassifizierten Zustand besonders zu kennzeichnen. Die Schlüsselnummern dieser Kategorie dürfen nur über das Deutsche Institut für Medizinische Dokumentation und Information (DIMDI) mit Inhalten belegt werden; eine Anwendung für andere Zwecke ist nicht erlaubt. DIMDI wird den Anwendungszeitraum solcher Schlüsselnummern bei Bedarf bekannt geben.

what: data.frame detailling the changes in ICD-10-GM codes between versions — icd_meta_transition
title: data.frame detailling the changes in ICD-10-GM codes between versions — icd_meta_transition
text: data.frame providing old new ICD codes (identical changes) information whether transition automatic transitioning forwards backwards

title: data.frame detailling the changes in ICD-10-GM codes between versions — icd_meta_transition
code: icd_meta_transition

title: data.frame detailling the changes in ICD-10-GM codes between versions — icd_meta_transition
text: object class data.frame 257310 rows 12 columns.

title: data.frame detailling the changes in ICD-10-GM codes between versions — icd_meta_transition
text: source data downloaded official download centre German Institute Medical Documentation Information (DIMDI). See also https://www.dimdi.de/dynamic/en/classifications/icd/icd-10-gm/tabular-list/#crosswalks

title: data.frame detailling the changes in ICD-10-GM codes between versions — icd_meta_transition
text: year_from Year validity old code (2004) year_to Year validity new code (2005) icd_from Old ICD code icd_to New ICD code automatic_forward Whether transition automatic forward direction (.e. old code can always converted new code). (: automatic, otherwise NA) automatic_backward Whether transition automatic forward direction (.e. new code can always converted old code) (: automatic, otherwise NA) change_5 Whether change relates fifth digit ICD-10 code (TRUE/FALSE). change_4 Whether change relates fourth digit ICD-10 code (TRUE/FALSE). change_3 Whether change relates three-digit ICD-10 code (TRUE/FALSE). icd3 first three digits icd_from. icd_chapter first character icd_from (.e. letter denoting chapter).

what: Extract all ICD codes from a character vector — icd_parse
title: Extract all ICD codes from a character vector — icd_parse
text: ICD code consists , minimum, three digit ICD-10 code (.e. one upper-case letter followed two digits). may optionally followed two digit subcode, selected punctuation symbols (cross "*", dagger "U2020" exclamation mark "!"). period separating three-digit code subcode, hyphen indicating "incomplete" subcode, optional. Finally, ambulatory system, additional letter G, V, Z may appended signify status ("security") diagnosis.

title: Extract all ICD codes from a character vector — icd_parse
code: icd_parse(str, type = "bounded", bind_rows = TRUE)

title: Extract all ICD codes from a character vector — icd_parse
text: str Character vector extract ICD codes type character string determining strictly matching performed. must one "strict" (str contains ICD code extraneous characters), bounded (str contains ICD code word boundary sides) weak (ICD codes extracted even contained within word, e.g. "E10Diabetes" return "E10"). Default: bounded. bind_rows logical. Whether convert matrix output stirngi::stri_match_all data.frame, additional icd_sub uniquely represent code allow lookup code

title: Extract all ICD codes from a character vector — icd_parse
text: data.frame (bind_rows = TRUE) matrix

title: Extract all ICD codes from a character vector — icd_parse
text: default, function returns data.frame containing matched codes standardised three digit code (icd3), subcode (icd_subcode), normcode (icd_norm) code without period (icd_sub). bind_rows = FALSE, list output stringi::stri_match_all_regex returned. particularly useful retrieve matches element str vector separately.

title: Extract all ICD codes from a character vector — icd_parse
code: icd_parse("E11.7") #>   icd_spec icd3 icd_subcode icd_security icd_sub #> 1    E11.7  E11           7                 E117 icd_parse("Depression: F32") #>          icd_spec icd3 icd_subcode icd_security icd_sub #> 1 Depression: F32  F32                              F32 icd_parse(c(   "Backpain (M54.9) is one of the most common diagnoses in primary care",   "Codes for chronic pain include R52.1 and F45.4"   )) #>                                                               icd_spec icd3 #> 1 Backpain (M54.9) is one of the most common diagnoses in primary care  M54 #> 2                       Codes for chronic pain include R52.1 and F45.4  R52 #> 3                       Codes for chronic pain include R52.1 and F45.4  F45 #>   icd_subcode icd_security icd_sub #> 1           9                 M549 #> 2           1                 R521 #> 3           4                 F454

title: Show historical changes to selected ICD-10-GM codes — icd_showchanges
code: icd_showchanges(icd_in, years = NULL)

title: Show historical changes to selected ICD-10-GM codes — icd_showchanges
text: icd_in Data frame created  icd_expand(), containing codes check years Years check, corresponding variable year_from icd_meta_transition

title: Show historical changes to selected ICD-10-GM codes — icd_showchanges
text: data.frame, icd_meta_transition, labels icd_from_label icd_to_label

title: Show historical changes to selected ICD-10-GM codes — icd_showchanges
code: dat_icd <- icd_expand(    data.frame(ICD_SPEC = c("K52.9")),    col_icd = "ICD_SPEC",    year = 2019) icd_showchanges(dat_icd) #>   year_from year_to icd_from icd_to automatic_forward automatic_backward #> 1      2009    2010    K52.9  A09.9                                      #>   change_5 change_4 change_3 change icd3 icd_kapitel #> 1    FALSE    FALSE     TRUE   TRUE  A09           A #>                                                        icd_from_label #> 1 Nichtinfektiöse Gastroenteritis und Kolitis, nicht näher bezeichnet #>                                                                                          icd_to_label #> 1 Sonstige und nicht näher bezeichnete Gastroenteritis und Kolitis nicht näher bezeichneten Ursprungs

what: Show historical changes to selected three-digit ICD-10-GM codes — icd_showchanges_icd3
title: Show historical changes to selected three-digit ICD-10-GM codes — icd_showchanges_icd3
text: Show changes ICD history relating 3-digit codes contained given vector icd

title: Show historical changes to selected three-digit ICD-10-GM codes — icd_showchanges_icd3
code: icd_showchanges_icd3(icd3)

title: Show historical changes to selected three-digit ICD-10-GM codes — icd_showchanges_icd3
text: icd3 Vector three-digit ICD codes

title: Show historical changes to selected three-digit ICD-10-GM codes — icd_showchanges_icd3
text: data.frame columns YEAR, ICD_CODE, ICD_LABEL , specified, DIAG_GROUP

title: Show historical changes to selected three-digit ICD-10-GM codes — icd_showchanges_icd3
code: icd_showchanges_icd3("A09") #>       year_from year_to icd_from icd_to automatic_forward automatic_backward #> 66424      2009    2010      A09  A09.0                                    A #> 66425      2009    2010      A09  A09.9                                      #> 70775      2009    2010    K52.9  A09.9                                      #>       change_5 change_4 change_3 change icd3 icd_kapitel #> 66424     TRUE    FALSE    FALSE   TRUE  A09           A #> 66425     TRUE    FALSE    FALSE   TRUE  A09           A #> 70775    FALSE    FALSE     TRUE   TRUE  A09           A

what: Test whether a string is a valid ICD code — is_icd_code
title: Test whether a string is a valid ICD code — is_icd_code
text: ICD code consists , minimum, three digit ICD-10 code (.e. one upper-case letter followed two digits). may optionally followed two digit subcode, selected punctuation symbols (cross "*", dagger "U2020" exclamation mark "!"). period separating three-digit code subcode, hyphen indicating "incomplete" subcode, optional. Finally, ambulatory system, additional letter G, V, Z may appended signify status ("security") diagnosis.

title: Test whether a string is a valid ICD code — is_icd_code
code: is_icd_code(str, year = NULL, parse = TRUE)

title: Test whether a string is a valid ICD code — is_icd_code
text: str Character vector tested year Year test whether specification valid code. Default: NULL (test whether str matches code year since 2003) parse logical. Whether first parse input str using icd_parse (Default: TRUE). FALSE, assumes str already formatted icd_sub (.e. without separating period punctuation)

title: Test whether a string is a valid ICD code — is_icd_code
text: Logical vector length character input

title: Test whether a string is a valid ICD code — is_icd_code
code: is_icd_code("A09.9") #> [1] TRUE is_icd_code("A099") #> [1] TRUE is_icd_code("A09.9-") #> [1] TRUE  is_icd_code("AA9") #> [1] FALSE  # The following code is syntactically correct but # has never been in use is_icd_code("E15.9") #> [1] FALSE

title: ICD10gm 1.2.5
text: minor update: Data year 2023 New function icd_lookup enable display label given code codes New function icd_browse open official documentation 3-digit code browser Replaced outdated URLs “Coding Pandemic” vignette archive.org snapshots

title: ICD10gm 1.2.4
text: CRAN release: 2021-12-05 minor update: Data year 2022 Corrected charlson_rcs specification (F00-F03 separate lines, #16) Replaced icd_showchanges equivalent query icd_meta_transitions. new function takes data.frame created icd_expand, extracts code changes within specified period (years), adds labels old new ICD-10-GM codes. (1.2.3): Corrected “visible binding” error icd_showchanges

title: ICD10gm 1.2.3
text: minor update: Data year 2022 Corrected charlson_rcs specification (F00-F03 separate lines, #16) Replaced icd_showchanges equivalent query icd_meta_transitions. new function takes data.frame created icd_expand, extracts code changes within specified period (years), adds labels old new ICD-10-GM codes.

title: ICD10gm 1.2.2
text: CRAN release: 2021-04-09 minor update: Added new ICD-10-GM data year 2021 Lazy data now compressed using xy algorithm (#15) Corrected ìcd_meta_chapters table (missing chapter 1, #14) Added new codes introduced Covid-19 2020 2021 versions New vignette “Coding Covid-19 pandemic Germany” Added supplementary datasets specifying two different versions Charlson comorbidities

title: ICD10gm 1.1
text: CRAN release: 2020-04-14 minor update: Added new ICD-10-GM data year 2020 Add reserved codes defined needed release download files (e.g. COVID-19) Improvements documentation cross-referencing functions New hex logo

title: ICD10gm 1.0.4
text: CRAN release: 2019-08-21 Minor updates preparation tidyr 1.0, primarily ensuring consistency type.

title: ICD10gm 1.0.3
text: CRAN release: 2019-02-12 CRAN resubmission: Description changed according CRAN guidelines (Deleted “ICD10gm package”) Examples added Rd files Vignette longer evaluates web-scraping example minor improvements documentation
